key_title: Key to the species of Paspalum

Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Glume glabrous along and near margins (a rudimentary lower glume may be present); inflorescence usually with two branches arising close together, rarely a solitary branch below the terminal pair
Glume ciliate on margins (lower glume lacking); inflorescences with 3-many branches arising at different levels along axis
(Upper) glume surface hairy; veins of leaves minutely scabrous on upper surface
(Upper) glume entirely glabrous; veins of leaves smooth or papillate on upper surface
(Upper) glume and lower lemma membranous; cauline leaves abundant, distinctly distichous, veins papillate on upper surface; saline coastal or estuarine areas
(Upper) glume and lower lemma firm; cauline leaves few, not distinctly distichous, veins smooth on upper surface; non-saline sites away from the coast
Fertile lemma distinctly shorter than glume and sterile lemma
Fertile lemma as long as or subequal to glume and sterile lemma
Spikelets more than 2.8 long and 1.7 mm wide; inflorescence of 3–10 racemes
Spikelets smaller than 2.8 long and 1.6 mm wide; inflorescence of 12–20 racemes
Glume hairy dorsally and near margins; axes of racemes not winged
Glume glabrous dorsally (but silky-hairy near margins); axis of racemes distinctly winged
